alert.note: Alert for Upper Treasure Valley; Western Magic Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 12:59PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Twin Falls, southeastern Elmore, eastern Owyhee and southwestern Gooding Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1258 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Twentymile Butte, or 19 miles southeast of Glenns Ferry, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hagerman, Twentymile Butte and Deadman Flat around 110 PM MDT. Glenns Ferry and Bliss around 120 PM MDT. White Arrow Hot Spring and King Hill around 130 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for south central and southwestern Idaho.

area.areaDesc: Upper Treasure Valley; Western Magic Valley
